meanings.definition: The functional tissue of an organ, as distinguished from the connective and supporting tissue.
meanings.sent1: The parenchymas of the leaf are responsible for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the parenchymas of the liver to understand its functions.
meanings.sent3: The parenchymas of the kidney decided to go on strike, causing chaos in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were the parenchymas of the project, driving its success.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green parenchymas of the plant were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The essential or functional elements of any structure.
meanings.sent1: In music, the melody and harmony are the parenchymas of a song.
meanings.sent2: The parenchymas of a good story include well-developed characters and a compelling plot.
meanings.sent3: The parenchymas of a successful business are hard work and innovation.
meanings.sent4: Laughter and love form the parenchymas of a happy family.
meanings.sent5: Trust and communication are the parenchymas of a strong relationship.
